and from Putao District in

), but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Vietnam , southwestern China and Peninsular Malaysia .

var. bracteata (Roxb.) N.Pearce & P.J.Cribb

165 m
,

( K ), ident. uncertain
.
BAGO . Taungoo District : without collector s.n. (not located, possibly K ), fide Rolfe (1905: 206)
.
Distribution:— India , the Himalayas, Myanmar , southwestern China and possibly Thailand .

f., Gard. Chron. , ser. 3, 4: 62, 1888.

(Rchb.f.) N.E.Br.
var. triloba

f.
subvar. triloba
(Rchb.f.) B.Grant,
Orch. Burma
: 208, 1895. Type:—ORIGIN UNKNOWN (probably Myanmar ). 1888, cult. Williams s.n. ( holotype : W).

Specimens examined:— ?
MYANMAR . Types . UPPER
MYANMAR . Type . WITHOUT LOCALITY
. Type .
Distribution:— Endemic.

Notes:— Rolfe (1905: 206) considered this to be a natural hybrid between
T. bensoniae
and
T. alba . Thunia brymeriana
was first mentioned by Bohnhof (1892: 184) as being a hybrid taxon, but no description was supplied. The above synonymy follows Rolfe.
